args: That night, the girl who suddenly\nappeared before me spoke of a\nheretofore unknown reality.
Why had this young woman, an alchemist,\ncome to be revered as the Goddess?
The story of how the Other was summoned.\nThe truth about the Holywyrm Elysium.
Ilia told me everything about the world\nof a thousand years ago.
Yet even as she spoke of the past,\nshe focused pointedly on the future.
Something about the powerful light\nglimmering in her eyes reminded me\nof {player_name}.
You are pactbound, yet you\nknow nothing of your pactwyrm?
My pactwyrm is the HOLYWYRM.\nIt's a totally different story than the\ndragons you've got here.
Wherever Elysium is, it's not far from\nthis world. It's faint...but I can feel it.
And that's why we came to this world.
I'm sure this world—standing as it is on\nthe cusp of transcending order—would be\nvery...inconvenient for Elysium.
Hmph. We have no need of the dragons'\n＂order＂ and their unseen rule.
I would take it all to the flame.\nUntil nothing is left.
Whoa, you had a move like that up\nyour sleeve? Way to crank the intensity\nright to eleven!
I had you pegged as a pretty reserved\nplayer, but I guess you were just building\nup to this the whole time, huh?
Proper preparation before the decisive\nclash is fundamental.
...And does that apply to the fight with\nElysium as well?
Naturally. The pieces are already\nin motion on that particular front.
So advancing your rule of southern\nGrastaea is in service to that, huh?\nBut this is you we're talking about.
You're not planning on stopping there,\nare you?
I suspect that from your perspective,\nsouthern Grastaea is too small a board...
The final cobblestone on your bloody\nfootpath... I'm guessing it's nothing\nshort of total world domination.
...You read my moves well.\nI commend you.
Are we talking about chess here? Or...?
Right now, there are three great powers\nin southern Grastaea.
One, the Kingdom of Alberia. Two, the\nKingdom of New Alberia, founded by my\nbrother. And finally, the Dyrenell Empire.
First, from here in Valkaheim,\nI will rebuild the Kingdom of Alberia.
I have also been entrusted with the\nadministration of New Alberia while\nmy brother is away.
Dyrenell, for its part, has been weakened\never since the Other's disappearance.
Evidently, Emile has become the emperor,\nbut...he is no threat. For the time being,\nwe should be safe to simply observe.
The activities of the north and the Ilian\nChurch pose some complications, but we\nwill deal with them swiftly in turn.
So you've already worked out a means\nto capture the whole southern Grastaean\nboard.
You think it'll all go that smoothly?
I know not. But I needn't worry.
There is a distinct pleasure in wresting\ncontrol back from a plan gone awry and\ncrushing your interloper without mercy.
Yeesh. You are one seriously nasty guy.
But you don't scare me!\nTime to attack again!
I suspected you would do that...which is\nwhy I molded the situation on the board\naccordingly.
Oho. I didn't realize you had that move\navailable. Splendid, Leonidas.
Baaaaah! I lost AGAIN! Why the\nheck can't I win even one game?!
I might not look like much, but I'm a\ngenius, you know! At least, that's what\neveryone always used to tell me!
Ugh, this is so annoying. When did you see\nyour path to winning the game, anyway?
*sigh* I've gotta hand it to you. Guess\nthat's why you're a famous conqueror.
I'm relieved you're on our side.\nFrom the bottom of my heart.\n
